instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (no battery)?
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
thanks for the welcome :)

voltage on ppbus 12.54v no battery
3v3_S5 3.32v; SUS 3.32V

using a 60W original magsafe

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).
You can use R5115/16 pads, instead of power button.

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
just to be sure i short the pads at R5116 and check for the voltage drop.

PS: yeah i shorted at R5116 and saw a drop at  PM_PWRBTN_L, i want to be sure to not kill it xD

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
Check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L, at same time.
If detected, you should catch pulse on some big coils too.

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message: PM_SLP_S4_L no voltage without short, no voltage while shorting, no pulse at big coils

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
You must make temporary short on mentioned resistors pad; like pressing power button.
Do not maintain the pads shorted.

If no reaction, there is PCH related problem.
Check PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_RSMRST_L and the 4 PCH's RTC signals (DC, not clock).

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
yeah i emulated a button press,  PM_SLP_S4_L is 0v pressed or not

PM_BATLOW_L 0.035v
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.32v
PCH_DSWVRMEN 3.32v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.29v
PM_RSMRST_L 3.29v

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 96060, member: 682"]
PCH's RTC
[/QUOTE]
don't quite know which one

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
"the 4 PCH's RTC signals"
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
Probably good...

"PM_BATLOW_L 0.035v"
There is the problem.
85W original Magsafe 2 charger for sure?

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message: damn it such a rookie mistake... the one the client always used was the one i was testing with... i wasted my and your time aaaaah, welp i have another one on which i need a pro opinion, will make a new thread

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
so the issue is different... the pc doesn't recognize the battery, that's why it worked with his old charger 60W because it was leveraging the battery before it stopped working... with the 80W the Mac turn on but it has battery symbol with X.

The battery is at 12V but won't turn on

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
Did you test with known good battery?

Please, open new thread, if you talk about other machine.

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message: this is the same machine, searching for another battery, but it came here with the same issue before

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
Be sure R7050 is good.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
R7050 is 10k

By " SCL/SDA" you mean smbus_smc_5_g3_scl and smbus_smc_5_g3_sda?
smbus smbus_smc_5_g3_scl 3.4v charger,3.2v battery, 2.3v diode
smbus_smc_5_g3_sda 3.4v charger, 3.2v battery, 2.2v diode

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
Read again the above linked thread.
This time pay atention to diode mode checking...

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
smbus smbus_smc_5_g3_scl 0.54v red on ground
smbus_smc_5_g3_sda 0.53v red to ground
sorry

PS: If i disconnect the power when the Mac is on it will be on, but if i don't give it power it won't turn on

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message:
The values are correct.
Battery is the first suspect there; test with known good one.
Be aware, "new chinese" is not same as "known good".

If you are in laptops repair bussines, get a dedicated tool to diagnose and repair the batteries.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.laptopu.ro/[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/dealing-with-nlba1-laptop-battery-tester-and-macbook-air-batteries.63433/[/URL]
Is the best tool on the market.

threads.title: 820-3662-A PP5V_S3 missing
threads.message: yeah... we buy only A+ grade batteries, i guess it was the clients power supply, we will change the battery and sell them the correct 85w power supply
